basics.name: Naman Shukla
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: I am studying M.S. in Advanced Analytics with thesis in Computer Science in the Department of Industrial Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign. I expect to graduate in May, 2019.

education.institution: University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign, IL
Indian Institute of Technology, Hyderabad, IND

highlights: Zenvisage is a visual exploration system that can automatically identify and recommend interesting visualizations. The user can specify at a high level what they are looking for, and the system will do the rest.
Zenvisage enables users to effortlessly receive visualization recommendations for interesting trends, patterns, and insights from large datasets.

work.company: Image to Image Translation by Cycle GANs
highlights: Accomplished Adversarial Training for horse to zebra to horse
Implemented computer vision algorithm from scratch to reconstruct 3D face from 2D images
Used Lambertian model with gaussian filtering to construct the baseline model
Attempted SIFT key point detection as a feature extraction on 3D model

work.company: Hand Written Image Recognition of USPS Dataset
highlights: Extracted features through kernel PCA on 7K images from USPS dataset
Implemented classification by training linear and kernel SVM with features produced by kernel PCA

work.company: Data Analytics of the Champaign County Jail System
highlights: Analyzed Champaign County Jail’s database of year 2015 – 16 (Local hack day initiative by Research Park)
Performed data visualization on different statistics extracted from database
Provided extended report to local county sheriff
Created a platform independent toolbox for model identification in biochemical reaction
Used algorithms for parameter estimation : Generic Algorithm, particle swarm optimization, BAT algorithm
Tested on lab data from IIT Bombay under the guidance of Professor Giri

awards.title: JASSO (TODAI) Scholarship
awards.summary: Selected among top 20 students worldwide to design innovation workshop for high school students of Miyazaki, Japan (JASSO Scholarship provided by the Japanese government)
